event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Fault was detected during poweron self-test, either within a Clock chip with within one of the external interfaces of a Clock chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Fault was detected during poweron self-test, either within a Clock chip or within one of the external
interfaces of a Clock chip.


   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platforms:

      The type of fault can be determined from the FMRI of the affected resource.
      Platform recovery actions depend on the type of fault encountered and will be one of the following:


         Clock chip fails during an internal self-test:

            Platform becomes unbootable.


         Clock path test between the CPU chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CPU chip is deconfigured.
     

         Clock path test between the SC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CMU and all its associated IO is deconfigured.
     

         Clock path test between the MAC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured.


   SPARC Enterprise M9000-32 platforms:

      The type of fault can be determined from the FMRI of the affected resource.
      Platform recovery actions depend on the type of fault encountered and will be one of the following:


         Clock chip fails during an internal self-test:

            Clock Unit is deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit.

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock path test between the XB chip and the Clock chip fails:
     
            Clock Unit is deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit.

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock path test between the CPU chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CPU chip is deconfigured.


         Clock path test between the SC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CMU and all its associated IO is deconfigured.


         Clock path test between the MAC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-64 platforms:

      The type of fault can be determined from the FMRI of the affected resource.
      Platform recovery actions depend on the type of fault encountered and will be one of the following:


         Clock chip fails during an internal self-test:

            The Clock Unit with the fault and its partner Clock Unit on the expansion cabinet
            are deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit.

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock chip on the base cabinet detects that the clock data cable is disconnected:

            The Clock Unit with the fault and its partner Clock Unit on the expansion cabinet
            are deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit.

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock chip on the expansion cabinet detects a clock oscillation failure:
   
            The Clock Unit with the fault and its partner Clock Unit on the expansion cabinet
            are deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit.

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock path test between the XB chip and the Clock chip fails:
     
            The Clock Unit with the fault and its partner Clock Unit on the expansion cabinet
            are deconfigured and the standby Clock Unit becomes the active Clock Unit..

               If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

                  Operational, then the platform will be reset;
                  Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.


         Clock path test between the CPU chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CPU chip is deconfigured.


         Clock path test between the SC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            CMU and all its associated IO is deconfigured.


         Clock path test between the MAC chip and the Clock chip fails:

            16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 14:47:39 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: dab061df-242f-486d-8c12-076868a4fbe4
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8000-4S for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8000-4S, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 14:47:39 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: dab061df-242f-486d-8c12-076868a4fbe4
   DESC: Fault was detected during poweron self-test, either within a Clock chip with within one of the external
   interfaces of a Clock chip.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8000-4S for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: An attempt will be made to remove the affected components from service. Please consult the detail
   section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The entire platform is reset. If the platform lacks redundant clock capability, the platform will be
   powered down and will not power up. If the platform has redundant clock capability, the platform will be
   reset and the faulty Clock Unit will be deconfigured during recovery.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u dab061df-242f-486d-8c12-076868a4fbe4

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 14:47:39.7177 dab061df-242f-486d-8c12-076868a4fbe4 SCF-8000-4S
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.clk.test

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0638K200:
                             part=CA06620-D321 A5:revision=0201/component=/CLKU_B#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.


If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The entire platform is reset. If the platform lacks redundant clock capability, the platform will be powered down and will not power up. If the platform has redundant clock capability, the platform will be reset and the faulty Clock Unit will be deconfigured during recovery.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: An attempt will be made to remove the affected components from service. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fault was detected during poweron self-test of a Clock chip.
